body: LEAD: Mayor Koch, whose repeated attacks on the Rev. Jesse Jackson overwhelmed the New York Democratic Presidential primary, conceded last night that his combative tactics had not helped his choice in the race, Senator Albert Gore Jr. ''There's no sense in rehashing the battle, and I think that the exit polls show that, 2 to 1, people did not like
title: Koch Says He Didn't Help Gore; Voters Say He Didn't Help Debate

body: LEAD: To the distress of many black New Yorkers, the 1988 Presidential primary here has become a painful study in black and white. They see it as a campaign tinged with racism, one in which the Rev. Jesse Jackson is neither forgiven any of his trespasses nor taken with the same seriousness accorded his white foes. To the distress of many black New
title: Many Black New Yorkers Believe Campaign Is Tinged With Racism

title: Koch Proposals to Convert 2 Buildings to Shelters Are Rejected

title: Federal-City Effort Attacks Violent Brooklyn Drug Ring

body: LEAD: The Rev. Milton A. Galamison, a Brooklyn pastor for four decades who was a major figure in the dispute over decentralizing the New York City schools in the 1960's, died of cancer Wednesday at his home in Brooklyn. He was 65 years old. Mr. Galamison, who wore a dashiki as he picketed construction sites to obtain more jobs for his fellow blacks
title: Milton Galamison, Leader in a Dispute Over the Schools, 65

body: LEAD: Late last summer, eight low-income families renovating an abandoned building in Brooklyn found themselves in a jam. title: New Financial Tool Revives Old Block

body: LEAD: In more than 20 years as a businessman in Brooklyn, Eric Bullen has faced riots and looting and mounting drug-related crime, including more burglaries than he cares to remember. title: Moslem Patrol Helps Cut Crime in Brooklyn

body: LEAD: NEW YORK CITY'S armories are generally elaborate structures, often with 200-foot-wide drill halls and unusual architectural character. But as the need for armories has declined since their heyday at the turn of the century, several have been demolished and it has been hard to find alternative uses for the others. title: Streetscapes: 13th Regiment Armory; A Brooklyn Fortress Yields to the Changing Times

title: Memo to Schools Chief: A System Adrift

body: LEAD: Within months of his acquittal on Federal charges of conspiring to organize a prisoner escape and rob armored cars, Roger Wareham, one of a group of black revolutionaries known as the New York Eight, landed a job at the Center for Law and Social Justice, where he helped establish a 24-hour hot line to monitor reports of police brutality.
title: Job for Radical Reflects Role of Brooklyn Group
